thread.title: New Margaritaville Resort bringing paradise, tiny umbrellas to Kissimmee
thread.title_full: New Margaritaville Resort bringing paradise, tiny umbrellas to Kissimmee

author: Richard Bilbao
title: New Margaritaville Resort bringing paradise, tiny umbrellas to Kissimmee
text:
Image provided by Getty Images (haveseen) Need to lounge by a beach? Well, a Margaritaville Resorts is on its way to Kissimmee. Love tiny umbrellas in your drinks? Well, you may find a haven for those at the new Margaritaville Resort planned for Kissimmee. The 300-acre resort, via a partnership with Margaritaville Holdings LLC and Encore Capital Management, will recreate lifestyle of musician Jimmy Buffet and "will offer many experiential opportunities including a 'FinCity' arcade, a St. Somewhere Spa, a planetarium and the Son of a Sailor fishing school, paddleboarding and kayaking," said a news release. The resort will be on U.S. Highway 192 near State Road 429 and will include a beach area, lake, a water park and more than 170,000 square feet of retail space. No details on the cost or timeline for the project were revealed. Additional communities like this in Central Florida provide variety for the region's 62 million visitors and can help build more annual visitation. It also creates more jobs in the hospitality industry and can be a catalyst for other forms of development nearby. “This vacation resort – offering such a variety of lodging options - will make Margaritaville available to everyone looking for a part of paradise in Orlando. Margaritaville is about escapism, relaxation and vacation, and we are excited to partner with Encore to develop such an exceptional experience,” said John Cohlan , CEO of Margaritaville Holdings, in a prepared statement.
